CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-3 - Length of pre-trial detention;Reasonableness of pre-trial detention)
JUDGES: Branko Lubarda;Georgios A. Serghides;Pere Pastor Vilanova
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lived , prior to his arrest , in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested . On an unspecified date he was charged with CARDINAL counts of pimping and pandering , extortion and illegal keeping of firearms . The court remanded him in custody .
CARDINAL . On DATE he was committed for trial before ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG extended his pre - trial detention ’s arrest , he was accused of a serious crime , did not live at his domicile , hence he could abscond , threaten witnesses and interfere with the investigation .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE ORG extended the applicant ’s pre - trial detention referring to the above grounds and stating that the victims of his crimes were minors . The court also took into account the applicant ’s character , his state of health and age .
CARDINAL . The applicant ’s appeals against the detention orders were rejected .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG convicted him as charged .
